title: Feature request: range with Variable
body_html:
Supporting Variable as the lowerbound and upperbound (or even the stepsize) in torch.range might be very useful for variable length sequence operations (e.g. RNNs).

Currently this throws a RuntimeError.

>>> import torch
>>> from torch.autograd import Variable
>>> import numpy as np
>>> len = Variable(torch.from_numpy(np.array([3], dtype=np.int32)))
>>> torch.range(0,len)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: Type Variable doesn't implement stateless method range
>>> torch.range(0,3)  # would want something like this

  0
  1
  2
  3
[torch.FloatTensor of size 4]

Let me know if I could help in any way with this!
